title: Danniella Westbrook says she's 'broody as hell' after devastating miscarriage
text:

Danniella Westbrook has admitted she's feeling broody as she takes on babysitting duties.

The former EastEnders actresss, 45, shared a video of herself taking care of a baby who she refers to as Caleb, saying: "I'm broody as hell - and it's all this kid's fault."

She added: "I just want one, I want one really bad."

Danniella's big reveal comes after she suffered a fourth miscarriage in 2017, which left her "heartbroken".

She was expecting her third baby with former fiance Alan Thomason at the time, but was given the devastating news she'd lost the baby - tragically the fourth time it had happened.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

She told The Sun Online : "I was last year, but this time most definitely because I thought, I'm 43, nearly 44 - there's no way I'm going to get pregnant again.

"There was always a chance I was going to miscarry because since I've had lots of problems since my daughter, who is 16, was born by an emergency C-section."

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

But the star had another harrowing experience when she was diagnosed with womb cancer in 2018 - although she was given the "all clear" in April this year.

She said doctors initially misdiagnosed her illness after finding a clot the size of a tangerine in her womb and they thought she was pregnant.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

Westbrook has two children of her own already - Kai Jenkins, 22, and Jody Jenkins, 17, with her second husband Kevin Jenkins, who she split from in 2014.

Danniella hasn't spoken to her daughter in three years, and admitted she's "safer with her dad", which comes after the ex-soap star's high-profile drug addiction.

Dani has since beaten her demons by going to rehab earlier this year to get clean once and for all.

She was due to share her journey to recovery in a special episode of The Jeremy Kyle Show, but the show was pulled before it could air in the wake of guest Steve Dymond's tragic death.
description: The former EastEnders actress admitted she's feeling broody following her miscarriage and cancer battle
